page.title: 17An Ambulance Station
page.content: Christchurch Ambulance Station is in Somerford and deals with about one call every two hours. To cope with this they have a variety of ambulances and equipment. They have: Two outpatient,one emergency,one geriatric and physchiatric ambulances There are fifteen men employed at the station,the busiest times are around breakfast time,lunchtime and during the evening rush hour. There is a large amount of equipment carried in each ambulance. For example ,an outpatient ambulance: An engineering can opener,for opening car rooves,stretchers ranging from the light aluminium to canvas and wood type.Oxygen equipment,including equipment to insert an oxygen tube into the lungs and special regulator masks.
